intro: Sagraea penninervis, commonly known as the slender sagraea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves with fine veins. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, often followed by small, red berries. Sagraea penninervis is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
